title: LOKI: KANG is a Descendant of TONY STARK | Marvel Theory BREAKDOWN | MCU Revealed
author: ScreenCrush
comment: Do you think Kang should be a Stark?

either he is related to Stark or he more than likely has an admiration of him, Stark is the reason Kang can travel through time. He could just have researched the origins of time travel and it lead all the way back to Stark, thats why he lets the Avengers get away with messing with the timeline, if not the technology might have not existed for Kang to use in the 31st century
On a long enough timeline, everyone will be someway related to Tony Stark.
Imagine creating a super soldier and still being the third smartest person in your family.
Dang…so Ms Minutes could be a fully evolved Friday?  Each program improved by the next generation…that would be amazing
description:
Loki is done and we're still--like the Time Keepers--untangling the epilogue. In the comics, Kang is actually a descendant of Reed Richards, of the Fantastic Four. But what if the Marvel Cinematic Universe gave us a different take? What if Kang is actually the great(x33) grandson of Tony Stark? It would tie in thematically with Iron Man, and help set up Iron Lad in the Young Avengers movie. It would also fit in with the themes of Captain America, Ant-Man, and Thor.
